description: A guide or manual outlining the processes, procedures, and best practices for procurement contracts within an organization.
A method of dispute resolution involving one or more neutral third parties who render a binding or non-binding decision.
The process of resolving conflicts or disagreements between parties, which may include negotiation, mediation, arbitration, or litigation.
The transfer of rights, obligations, or duties under a contract from one party to another.
The act of replacing an obligation to perform with a new obligation; requires the consent of all parties.
A change in the controlling ownership of a company, often triggering specific contractual provisions.
The process of determining the meaning and legal effect of the terms of a contract.
Actions taken to reduce or minimize potential legal or financial liabilities.
A contractual obligation requiring a party to make a diligent and reasonable effort to fulfill a commitment, but not necessarily guaranteeing success.
The process of conducting a thorough investigation and analysis of a business or person prior to entering into a contract or agreement.
The process of estimating and reporting potential liabilities based on forecasted demands and orders.
Liability related to costs incurred for components or materials ordered before a firm order is received or in anticipation of forecasted orders.
